metadata.title: CVE-2014-2905 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
fish (aka fish-shell) 1.16.0 before 2.1.1 does not properly check thecredentials, which allows local users to gain privileges via the universalvariable socket, related to /tmp/fishd.socket.user permissions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-2905` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

fish - 2.1.1-1
fish-common - 2.1.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: fish package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.1-1').
